alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 30 at 11:15PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: .Deep monsoonal moisture spreads across central and northern Nevada by Monday afternoon. The strongest storms will have the potential for heavy rain. Flash flooding will be a threat for burn scars, vulnerable canyons and backcountry roads where drainage may be poor. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Southeastern Elko County. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong thunderstorms will have the potential to generate heavy rain with rates of 1 to 2 inches an hour. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
